title: 112_hr5739
content: The Act may be cited as the "Former Charleston Naval Base Land Exchange Act of 2012". It includes definitions for various terms used in the Act. The Act defines "Federal land" as approximately 10.499 acres of land in North Charleston, South Carolina, owned by the United States, and "non-Federal land" as 3 parcels authorized to be conveyed to the United States. The term "Secretary" refers to the Secretary of Homeland Security. The term "State Ports Authority" refers to the South Carolina State Ports Authority, an agency of the State of South Carolina. SEC. 3. LAND EXCHANGE. In a land exchange agreement, the State Ports Authority will convey non-Federal land to the Secretary in exchange for Federal land. The Secretary is authorized to accept the offer and simultaneously convey the Federal land to the State Ports Authority. The State Ports Authority will convey approximately 18.736 acres of land on S. Hobson Avenue and 4.069 acres on Thompson Avenue and the Cooper River to the Secretary in exchange for approximately 10.499 acres of Federal land. The State Ports Authority will convey approximately 18.736 acres of land on S. Hobson Avenue and 4.069 acres on Thompson Avenue and the Cooper River to the Secretary in exchange for approximately 10.499 acres of Federal land. The non-Federal land conveyed to the Secretary must have acceptable title and conform to the Attorney General's title approval standards for land acquisitions. The Attorney General's title approval standards apply to land acquisitions by the Federal Government. The conveyance of Federal land under section 3 is subject to valid existing rights and additional terms determined by the Secretary. Costs for the land exchange will be shared equally by the Secretary and the State Ports Authority. The values of the Federal and non-Federal land in the exchange are considered equal. Additionally, there will be a boundary adjustment. SEC. 5. BOUNDARY ADJUSTMENT. The non-Federal land will be added to the Federal Law Enforcement Training Center, and the boundaries of the Center will be adjusted to exclude the exchanged Federal land.
